result.execSummary:
The defendant Brina J. Karpinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brina J. Karpinski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brina J. Karpinski was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate-Control. Substance (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dodge County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant to pay restitution and all applicable fees and surcharges within the term of probation.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Obtain high school diploma or its equivalent.

Write a letter of apology to victims, subject to approval of Agent.

Defendant must attend and comply with the terms of alcohol court. Probation Review Hearing set 12/12/14 at 4:00 p.m. in Br. 1.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 12/26/14.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed
Defendant to perform 40 hours of community service each year of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Shall serve 9 months DCJ w/h&t commencing forthwith.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO 15CM300; with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 12, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Brina J. Karpinski in court with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.   Restitution of $4645.06 agreed to and ordered by Court.  Court reviews stipulation with DE.  Court reviews charge/penalty.  DE pleads guilty to Count 1 of amended information.  Court reviews PQWOR with DE.  Stipulation to facts.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and and finds guilty of Count 1, Count 2 is DRI.  Atty. Thompson is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Wineke responds.  Defendant makes statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:


Sentence withheld -
Probation for 2 years with conditions:
10 days DCJ with H&T, commencing on 12/26/14 - 1/4/14, 
40 hours community service each year of probation,
obtain high school diploma
$300 fine plus costs and driver improvement surcharge,
$26 blood draw fee to BDCH,
Restitution of $4645.06,
Shall not use or possess controlled substances without legal prescription,
Not use or possess drug paraphernalia,
AODA and follow through,
Absolute sobriety, 
No premises of bars/taverns etc.,
Not operate MV without valid license,
VIP within 120 days,
Letter of apology to victims.  

Operating priviledge is revoked for 18 months.  
  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 6, 2014 at 09:45 am.
for continuance

Defendant Brina J. Karpinski in court with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties stipulate to the defendant making a plea to Count 1 of the amended Information.  Based upon the plea, Count 2 will be DRI.  The Court is adjourning this matter to determine whether the defendant wants to proceed with the probation sentence or not.

Defendant Brina J. Karpinski in court with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Yolanda J Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on June 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant, Brina J. Karpinski in court, James Thomas Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:15 am.
